intro: Croton ankeranae, commonly known as the Ankerana croton, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant features thick, waxy leaves that can vary in color from green to red and orange, depending on the variety. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
